Carbon monoxide concentration in Delta del Paraná fires

30 day map challenge
Remote Sensing
Created for Day 10 (Air) of the #30daymapchallenge, this project shows the CO levels over the Paraná Delta, Argentina, during the 2020 wildfires vs. 2022 values.
Published

November 10, 2025

Project Overview

Sentinel-5P (TROPOMI) dataset was used to visualize carbon monoxide (CO) levels over the Paraná Delta (Argentina) during the 2020 wildfires, compared with 2022 values.

Remote sensing, in this case, makes it possible to detect fires through atmospheric gases and helps us understand how these events affect not only ecosystems but also nearby cities and communities.

This work was part of the course “Geostationary Satellites and their Applications to Hydrometeorology”, which I completed at the Gulich Institute (UNC–CONAE) in late 2024.

Data Sources and Tools

  • ESA’s Sentinel-5P (TROPOMI) with Google Earth Engine
  • Province boundaries: National Geography Institute of Argentina
  • Basemap: Argenmap by National Geography Institute of Argentina
  • Made with GIS 3.22.4-Białowieża

Google Earth Engine code

Click to view 
GEE Script Day 10-Air
//1. Add Region of Interest (roi) from assets
Map.addLayer(roi.style({color: 'purple', fillColor: '00000000', width: 2}), {}, 'ROI');

// 2. Define dates
var date1_start = '2020-07-01';
var date1_end   = '2020-07-31'; 

var date2_start = '2022-07-01';
var date2_end   = '2022-07-31';

// 3. Define palette and create legend
var vizParams = {
  min: 0.0197,
  max: 0.037,
  palette: ['#fff7ec', '#fee8c8', '#fdd49e', '#fdbb84', '#fc8d59', '#ef6548', '#d7301f', '#b30000', '#7f0000']
};

// 4. Load the TROPOMI CO collection and filter
var image1 = ee.ImageCollection('COPERNICUS/S5P/OFFL/L3_CO')
  .select('CO_column_number_density').filterDate(date1_start, date1_end).mean().clip(roi);
var image2 = ee.ImageCollection('COPERNICUS/S5P/OFFL/L3_CO')
  .select('CO_column_number_density').filterDate(date2_start, date2_end).mean().clip(roi);

// 5. Visualization in GEE with legend
// 5.1. Legend function
function addLegend(title, palette, min, max, labels) {
  var legend = ui.Panel({
    style: {
      position: 'bottom-left',
      padding: '8px 15px'
    }
  });
  var legendTitle = ui.Label({
    value: title,
    style: {
      fontWeight: 'bold',
      fontSize: '14px',
      margin: '0 0 4px 0',
      color: 'black'
    }
  });
  legend.add(legendTitle);
  var lon = ee.Image.pixelLonLat().select('longitude');
  var gradient = lon.multiply((max - min) / 100.0).add(min);
  var legendImage = gradient.visualize({min: min, max: max, palette: palette});
  var thumbnail = ui.Thumbnail({
    image: legendImage,
    params: {bbox: [0, 0, 100, 10], dimensions: '200x20'},
    style: {margin: '4px 0'}
  });
  legend.add(thumbnail);
  var labelPanel = ui.Panel({
    widgets: [
      ui.Label(labels[0], {margin: '0 8px'}),
      ui.Label(labels[1], {margin: '0 8px', textAlign: 'right', stretch: 'horizontal'})
    ],
    layout: ui.Panel.Layout.flow('horizontal')
  });

  legend.add(labelPanel);
  Map.add(legend);
}
// 5.2. Final viz
addLegend('CO (mol/m²)', vizParams.palette, vizParams.min, vizParams.max, [vizParams.min, vizParams.max]);
Map.centerObject(roi);
Map.addLayer(image1, vizParams, 'CO Level - 2020');
Map.addLayer(image2, vizParams, 'CO Level - 2022');

The final map for Day 10
